div.l: For in the town̄ / ther nas no prentice
That fairer coude cast / a peire of dyce
Than ꝑperkyn kouthe / ⁊and therto he was free
Of his dispence / in place of privite
¶ That fonde his maist̉er wel / in his cheffare
For ofte tyme / he fonde his box ful bare
For sekerly / a prentys Revelour͗e
That hauntith dys / riot or ꝑparamour͗e
His maister shal it / in his shoppe abye
Al haue he not parte / of the mynstralcye
¶ For thefft ⁊and Riot / thei ben conủertible
Al konne he pley / on giterne or Rubible
Reuel ⁊and trouthe / as in a a loughe degre
They ben ful wroth alday / as men may se
This ioly prentis / with his maist̉er boode
Til he were nygh out / of his prentishoode
Al were he snybbed / both erly ⁊and late
And somtyme ladde with reuel / to Newgate
But at the laste / his maister him bithoughte
Vppon a day / whan he his paupire soughte
Of a ꝓproủerbe that seith / this same worde
Wel bet is roten appul / owt of horde
Than that it rotie / al the remenaunt
So fareth it / bi a riotous s̉eruaunt
It is ful lasse harm / to late him pase
Than he shende / alle the s̉eruauntis in the place
Therfore his maist̉er / yaff him a quitaunce
And bade him go / with sorow ⁊and meschaunce
And thus this Ioly prentys / hadde his leve
Now late him riote / al the night or leve
And for ther is no theff withouten a lowke
That helpith him / to wasten ⁊and to sowke
Of that he bribe can / or borowe may
Anoon he sende his bedde / ⁊and his array
Vn to a compere / of his owne sorte
That louede dys / ⁊and reuel / ⁊and disporte
